item.title: Amnesia and White Widow Update
item.content:encoded:
Amnesia is doing good! I think it may still need some more nutrients due to the yellowish sheen, but I think overall it's doing great! Here is a photo from a few days ago

And here is one today. As you can see, quite a bit of growth!Pl

I'm still a bit sad about the loss of our Liberty Haze, but happy that our White Widow seeds are kicking butt! Here are photos from when we transferred the seeds to the trays yesterday:

 

 

And here are the seeds today! As you can see, they are ready to rock and roll!

item.title: Good bye Liberty haze and hello white widow
item.content:encoded:
It looks like mold got to the Liberty haze seeds. I think I put too much water in the seedling tray which over saturated the seeds and led to mold growth. RIP.

Lesson learned, now on to white widow, which are our last seeds so we will need to order some more.

item.title: Liberty Haze and Amnesia update
item.content:encoded:
The first seed is doing great and I can see it start to sprout in the worm castings:

I'm not so sure about the second one unfortunately. I may have waited too long before moving it into the growing medium? I see something that kinda looks like a cap of the seed, but not sure. Will give it time, maybe I didn't bury it deep enough?

Amnesia however is doing great!

item.title: Amnesia Survivor Seedling
item.content:encoded: She’s doing great so far! Excited to see how big her buds get!

item.title: Liberty Haze into trays
item.content:encoded:
Got the Liberty Haze seeds up and running! I started by filling up my seedling tray with worm castings. I figure it can help provide it a good start.

They both look healthy and strong! I’m excited for their growth!

Safely tucked away in their little nests to grow up big and strong!

Now we just wait for them to sprout!

item.title: Liberty Haze - moved seeds to paper towels
Amnesia disaster
item.content:encoded: Because of my negligence, 2 of the 3 seedlings died in the seedling trays. An expensive lesson learned ($20). An additional lesson learned is to be careful when adding seeds to water. Make sure you put the water in first, not vice versa. Thankfully, the two new seeds are ok and floating in water currently. They will be put into paper towels soon! The two new seeds are Liberty Haze.

item.title: Grow Journal - Prepping soil for Amnesia seedlings to transplant
item.content:encoded:
Yesterday I realized I had a piece of wood laying around that was the perfect width for the shelf slot on my Costco shed. I cut it to the right length, and bam I have a gardening shelf in my bike shed!

I took the old dirt and cleaned out the old plants from it.

I then mixed in a half trowel of earthworm castings as fertilizer to recharge the soil. I’ll be using nutrients too so I think we will be fine recycling the dirt.

We then planted our little seedlings!

item.title: 09/03/2023 - Amnesia Seedlings starting to sprout
item.content:encoded:
ChatGPT is saying that they should be ready for harvest between November 10, 2023, and December 1, 2023. We put them in water on August 25th.

Excited to see how they look! Going to start a grow journal for this plant and hopefully do a better job of tracking it.

We still need to order more rocket fuel.

We need to figure out a better automated water situation? Specifically the lid of the existing bag keeps coming off which could contaminate the water. I should 3d print something that allows air to go through but not bugs and dust.
